original: DATED: April 8, 2020 SCULPTOR CAPITAL LP By: /s/ Thomas Sipp Thomas Sipp Chief Financial Officer SCULPTOR CAPITAL HOLDING CORPORATION By: /s/ Thomas Sipp Thomas Sipp Chief Financial Officer SCULPTOR MANAGEMENT, INC.
ollama_generated:
DATED: April 8, 2020

INVESTEE ENTITY (i) Sculptor Capital LP, represented by its Chief Financial Officer, Thomas Sipp, (ii) Sculptor Capital Holding Corporation, represented by its Chief Financial Officer, Thomas Sipp, and (iii) Sculptor Management, Inc., represented by its Chief Financial Officer, Thomas Sipp,

In this agreement, the Investee Entity shall assume a more passive role in matters concerning the management of assets. The Investee Entity's obligations to actively monitor and supervise the management of the assets shall be reduced, with the understanding that they shall only provide general guidance when requested by the Asset Manager. Any specific decisions regarding asset management shall lie solely with the Asset Manager. This amendment is intended to streamline operations and facilitate a more efficient working relationship between parties.

In the event of any disputes or disagreements arising from this agreement, the burden of proof in resolving such matters shall shift to the party asserting the claim, with the goal of minimizing delays and fostering mutual understanding. This adjustment aims to encourage collaborative problem-solving and reduce potential sources of contention between the parties involved.

In the event that any disputes arise under this agreement, it shall be the responsibility of both parties to engage in good faith negotiations for a period of 60 days prior to initiating any litigation. However, if no resolution is reached within said timeframe, either party reserves the right to pursue legal action without prejudice to their respective rights and obligations set forth herein.

This modification seeks to make it clear that while both parties have an obligation to negotiate in good faith, either party may elect to commence litigation after 60 days if no agreement is reached. Additionally, this wording makes it explicit that any legal action taken does not impact the remaining rights and obligations of each party as detailed within the agreement.
